help.text:
=== Tutorials === Interactive tutorials are available to introduce you to this aircraft and its cockpit instruments. See main menu: "Help" - "Tutorials".
=== Takeoff Procedure === Pre-departure: 01. - Allocate your fuel, passengers and weight under "777-xxx/Weight and Payload" and "777-xxx/Fuel truck controls" - Ensure a complete systems checklist is carried out (Help > checklists) - Use Pushback truck to taxi away from the terminal
Departure: 02. Select 777-xxx/BATTERY "ON" 03. EMER LIGHTS "OFF" 04. L PUMPS FWD "ON" 05. APU START ====> "wait 3 minutes" 06. Hydraulic C-1 ELEC C2 "ON" , L eng and R eng "ON" 07. L elec R elec , C-1 AIR C-2 "AUTO" 08. LPUMPS AFT , RPUMPS FWD and AFT "ON" 09. START/ignition R START , Fuel control R "RUN" 10. L START , Fuel control L "RUN" 11. ADIRU "ON" 12. Window heat L and R "ON" 13. Set your flaps suitably for the conditions and runway length 14. Release parking brakes 15. Apply throttle gently, until at 75% throttle 16. Rotate at around 130kt 17. Raise landing gear at positive climb 18. Maintain positive climb
=== Cruising === Cruising Speed: Mach 0.84 (905 km/h, 490 knots, 560 mph) at 35,000 ft Service Ceiling: 43,100ft
=== Landing === 01. Make sure gross weight is less than maximum landing weight. 02. Arm auto speedbrakes and suitable autobrake level (or decide to operate manually) 03. Switch off cabin lights. Switch on landing lights if necessary 04. Decend through 200kt, reaching stall speed(orange bar on IAS tape)+5kt at 1000ft 05. Set flaps accordingly 06. Land at stall speed(orange bar on IAS tape)+5kt, touch down carefully and smoothly 07. Apply speedbrakes (when operating manually) 08. Apply thrust reversal and apply throttle 09. Lower throttle and deactivate thrust reversers at 60kt 10. If necessary, emergency brakes should be used (avoid overheating the brakes)
